item.description:
Plan to arrive in time to be in your kayak and ready to paddle at 6:30 and we'll stay out until 8:30 (sunset is at 8:14) at the latest.  We'll head out across the lake to the big island and then meander through coves and boggy areas to look for wildlife. Bring a headlamp or flashlight since we will be out just past sunset. This is not a trip for beginners who have no experience paddling and staying with a group.

The parking and launch is on Route 135 between Hopkinton and Westborough centers, approx 42.24166 North and 71.57316 West.  Do not program "Whitehall State Park" into your GPS. That will not take you to the launch site.

(PLEASE NOTE - The organizers in this group are NOT trained leaders or instructors.  The organizers only set the time and place, each person participating in any group trip is responsible for their own safety.  Each participant is responsible for evaluating all relevant conditions for the trip and determining if their skills and equipment are appropriate for those conditions.)
item.name: Whitehall After-Work Paddle
